rev.comment: this is not really frontends, is it?
rev.diff:
Line 68: Line 68:
Since GRUB Legacy is still the most widely used version among end users, but official development is being done on a different version, several other projects maintain their own enhancements ([[fork (software development)|forks]]) to the GRUB Legacy code in the meantime. These include [http://www.supergrubdisk.org/ Super Grub Disk] (new commands include "setgrubdevice" and "usbshift") and [https://gna.org/projects/grub4dos/ GRUB for DOS] ([http://svn.gna.org/viewcvs/grub4dos/trunk/README_GRUB4DOS.txt?view=auto several commands] were enhanced, including "find --set-root", "map --hook", and "cdrom").
Since GRUB Legacy is still the most widely used version among end users, but official development is being done on a different version, several other projects maintain their own enhancements ([[fork (software development)|forks]]) to the GRUB Legacy code in the meantime. These include [http://www.supergrubdisk.org/ Super Grub Disk] (new commands include "setgrubdevice" and "usbshift") and [https://gna.org/projects/grub4dos/ GRUB for DOS] ([http://svn.gna.org/viewcvs/grub4dos/trunk/README_GRUB4DOS.txt?view=auto several commands] were enhanced, including "find --set-root", "map --hook", and "cdrom").

== Frontends==
+
== GRUB editors ==
KGRUBEditor is a system [[GUI]] tool to view and edit the GRUB boot loader, written in the [[KDE]]4 libraries. <ref>[http://www.kde-apps.org/content/show.php?content=75442 KGRUBEditor KDE-Apps.org<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
KGRUBEditor is a system [[GUI]] tool to view and edit the GRUB boot loader, written in the [[KDE]]4 libraries. <ref>[http://www.kde-apps.org/content/show.php?content=75442 KGRUBEditor KDE-Apps.org<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
